Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an oinochoe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of hound running to right (part of head, neck, shoulder, right front leg and added red on neck remaining) with part of undetermined motif below jaw, possibly an animal in its teeth; below, dilute band above a band with superimposed red.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Alexandria 9527 is probably from the same vase
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 462, no. B784)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0311) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
